N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 829.1 - Transportation of race horses

State Regulations
(a) All
motor carriers of race horses, as that term is defined in Part 800, are
authorized to establish and maintain by filing and posting in the manner
provided in the commissioner's tariff regulations, rates for the transportation
of race horses dependent upon the released value of the property declared by
the shipper in writing, or agreed upon in writing, as follows: Released

Valuation

Rate

Basis

Released to a value not exceeding $200 per
animal

Base Rate

Released to a value exceeding $200 per
animal
5 cents for each $100 or fraction thereof of
excess value per animal for each 100 miles or fraction thereof of distance from
point of origin to destination as determined in accordance with the tariff
provisions. (b) No change in commodity description or in
released valuation upon which the rates are dependent shall be made without
specific authority of this commissioner. (c) The rates dependent on released value
filed under authority of this section shall show in connection therewith the
following notation: "Ratings herein based on released value have been
authorized by the Department of Transportation, State of New York, in Released

Rates Order DOT-NY No. M-3 [ยง
829.1
of this Part] of September
4, 1951, subject to complaint or suspension."
(d) The commissioner does not hereby approve
the lawfulness, except under section 63-v of the Transportation Law, of any
rates or valuations which may be filed under this authority. Notes
